flying: This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.
trample: This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.
deathtouch: Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.
lifelink: Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.
vigilance: Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.
reach: This creature can block creatures with flying.
haste: This creature can attack or tap as soon as it comes under your control.
hexproof: This permanent can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.
indestructible: Effects that say 'destroy' don't destroy this permanent. A creature with indestructible isn't destroyed by lethal damage.
ward: Whenever this permanent becomes the target of a spell or ability an opponent controls, counter it unless that player pays the associated cost.
menace: This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
first strike: This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.
double strike: This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.
flash: You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.
scry: To scry N, look at the top N cards of your library, then put any number of them on the bottom of your library and the rest on top in any order.
surveil: To surveil N, look at the top N cards of your library, then put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest on top in any order.
prowess: Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, this creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
enchant: This card can be attached to the designated permanent type (e.g., 'Enchant creature').
equip: Pay the cost to attach this permanent to a creature you control. Activate only as a sorcery.
fight: Each creature deals damage equal to its power to the other.
mill: To mill a card, a player puts the top card of their library into their graveyard.
toxic: Players dealt combat damage by this creature also get a number of poison counters equal to its toxic value.
connive: To have a creature connive, draw a card, then discard a card. If you discarded a nonland card, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.
dredge N: If you would draw a card, instead you may put exactly N cards from the top of your library into your graveyard. If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand.
